plugins.name: Find Word Duplicates Ninja
plugins.description:
Find Word Duplicate Ninja is your reliable assistant for quickly spotting and managing duplicate words within your designs.


Key Features:


Duplicate Word Detection:

Instantly find duplicate words across all text layers.


Automatic Highlighting:

Automatically highlights all occurrences of duplicate words for easy identification.


Customizable Settings:

Adjust minimum word length to match your specific project needs.


Seamless Navigation:

Click a duplicate word tag to navigate directly to all its occurrences within your design.


Intuitive User Interface:

Stylish, user-friendly interface with well-designed tags for optimal usability.


Performance Optimized:

Efficiently handles large files without slowing down Figma's performance.


Why Choose Find Word Duplicate Ninja?


Boost Productivity:

Quickly catch duplicate words, save time, and streamline your workflow.


Improve Consistency:

Ensure consistent text throughout your project without any overlooked duplications.


Easy to Use:

Intuitive and straightforward interface suitable for designers of all levels.

accepted.name: BrandNinjas
accepted.description: UI/UX designer crafting Figma plugins for creatives and efficiency seekers.

plugins.tagline: Quickly identify and highlight duplicate words in your designs.

plugins.name: Figma Instance Mode
plugins.description:
Inspired by this post: Please add an "Instance Selection" mode - Share an idea - Figma Community Forum


🔶 Introducing Figma Instance Mode


- ⤴️ Select Instance

- ✅ Instance Mode On

- 🚫 Instance Mode Off


⤴️ Select Instance


check if there is a parent or ancestor instance with your selection, and then will redirect your selection to the instance


It is the same as the official feature named `select instance`, but with this plugin you can blind a hotkey to this feature.


✅ Instance Mode On


Once you run this command, every time when you change your selection in Figma will run the `⤴️ Select Instance` command automatically which means you will always select the instance if your selection is within a instance.


And there will be a inspect window to show the program running result, you can get information with it.


🚫 Instance Mode Off


This feature is to turn off the instance mode, and close the inspect window


🔶 How to add GLOBAL SHORTCUT in MacOS


Check the tutorial: Custom-shortcuts-in-figma by Jussi Virtanen


MacOS Global Shortcut Path:


Plugins->Saved plugins->Figma Instance Mode->⤴️ Select Instance


Plugins->Saved plugins->Figma Instance Mode->✅ Instance Mode On


Plugins->Saved plugins->Figma Instance Mode->🚫 Instance Mode Off

accepted.name: RyanHuang 👀
accepted.description:
🔸 Product Designer
🔸 Heavy user of Figma
🔸 Beginner in FE

plugins.tagline: Selecting parent/ancestor instances automatically

plugins.name: Combine Pages
plugins.description:
A Figma plugin built for designers who value organization just as much as iteration.


Whether you're wrapping up a sprint, handing off files, or simply cleaning house, Archive & Combine Pages helps you bring order to your design file with ease. Select any number of pages, and this plugin will neatly group their content into a single new page titled Archive [date]. Each page’s content is preserved as a section, spaced evenly and grouped for clarity. Once processed, original pages are renamed with an ARCHIVED_ prefix — so nothing gets lost, but everything gets tidied.
plugins.tagline: Merge pages. Archive cleanly.

128785.name: Combine Pages
128785.description:

Whether you're wrapping up a sprint, handing off files, or simply cleaning house, Archive & Combine Pages helps you bring order to your design file with ease. Select any number of pages, and this plugin will neatly group their content into a single new page titled Archive [date]. Each page’s content is preserved as a section, spaced evenly and grouped for clarity. Once processed, original pages are renamed with an ARCHIVED_ prefix — so nothing gets lost, but everything gets tidied.

plugins.name: Ai Design Review
plugins.description:
Transform Your Design Process with AI-powered Insights


Ai Design Review is a cutting-edge Figma plugin designed to help designers optimize their work by providing AI-driven design reviews. With this plugin, you can instantly analyze your designs and receive suggestions for improvement based on best practices in typography, layout, color schemes, accessibility, and overall visual consistency.


By utilizing AI technology, Ai Design Review helps you ensure that your designs adhere to industry standards, making your workflow more efficient and your designs more polished. The plugin automatically scans your design file, analyzes it against key design principles, and highlights potential issues, offering actionable insights and suggestions to improve the design's quality and user experience.


Whether you're a solo designer or part of a design team, Ai Design Review will serve as your AI assistant, providing real-time feedback to enhance your design’s impact and usability.


Key Features:

Automated Design Analysis: Instantly scan your designs for inconsistencies, color imbalances, accessibility issues, and more.


AI-Driven Recommendations: Receive intelligent suggestions for design improvements tailored to your project.


Customizable Feedback: Choose the types of design elements you want to receive feedback on, such as typography, spacing, or color.


Efficient Workflow: Save time and enhance collaboration by automatically detecting and fixing common design mistakes.


Boost your design efficiency and improve your work with Ai Design Review — your AI-powered design assistant.
plugins.tagline: Enhance your designs with AI-powered insights for better quality and consistency

125135.name: Ai Design Review
125135.description:

The plugin automatically scans your design file, analyzes it against key design principles, and highlights potential issues, offering actionable insights and suggestions to improve the design's quality and user experience.

plugins.name: WCAG Contrast Checker|🔎 تحليل التباين وفقًا لـ WCAG
plugins.description:
في تجربة المستخدم، وضوح النصوص على الخلفيات يلعب دورًا أساسيًا في ضمان قراءة مريحة وسهلة للجميع، بما في ذلك الأشخاص ذوي الإعاقة البصرية. وهنا يأتي دور معايير WCAG التي تحدد نسبة التباين المثلى بين النص والخلفية.


💡 كيف يعمل البلغين؟

📌 حدد النص والخلفية داخل Figma، ثم اضغط على “تحليل التباين”. سيقوم البلغين بحساب نسبة التباين وإظهار تنبيه فوري يخبرك إن كان التباين متوافقًا أو غير متوافق وفقًا لمعايير WCAG.


✅ لماذا هذا مهم؟

✔️ يضمن وضوح النصوص وتحسين تجربة القراءة.

✔️ يساعد المصممين في تحقيق معايير إمكانية الوصول (Accessibility).

✔️ يختصر الوقت في اختبار الألوان داخل التصميم.
plugins.tagline: WCAG Contrast Checker|🔎 تحليل التباين وفقًا لـ WCAG

plugins.name: RadiusCluster
plugins.description:
智能分析各图层的圆角半径使用情况，提供圆角数值聚类可视化视图，并实现批量标准化，以保持设计的一致性。 对于设计系统团队和多设计人员项目来说至关重要。


Intelligently analyzes corner radius usage across layers, groups similar values into visual clusters, and enables bulk standardization to maintain design consistency. Essential for design system teams and multi-designer projects.

plugins.name: Thumbnail Resizer
plugins.description:
Thumbnail Resizer streamlines the process of creating multiple sized thumbnails from a single design. With this plugin, you can:


  1. Quickly generate thumbnails in various preset sizes for popular platforms
  2. Create custom size presets for your specific needs
  3. Batch resize selected elements with just a few clicks
  4. Save and reuse your frequently used size combinations


Perfect for social media marketers, UI/UX designers, and anyone who needs to create multiple versions of their designs efficiently. Save time and ensure consistency across all your thumbnail sizes with Thumbnail Resizer.
plugins.tagline: Quick and easy thumbnail creation for multiple sizes

105554.name: Thumbnail Resizer
105554.description:

  2. Create custom size presets for your specific needs
  3. Batch resize selected elements with just a few clicks
  4. Save and reuse your frequently used size combinations


Perfect for social media marketers, UI/UX designers, and anyone who needs to create multiple versions of their designs efficiently. Save time and ensure consistency across all your thumbnail sizes with Thumbnail Resizer.
105554.tagline: Quick and easy thumbnail creation for multiple sizes

plugins.name: TapTail
plugins.description:
😌 No explicit sign-ups, logins or permissions are required to use TapTail. Just run the plugin!


Have you ever wanted to know if the Figma proto you shared was opened? To see where people clicked? To get insights how your proto works? Read on 👇


Use this example prototype created by Figma to try: https://www.figma.com/community/file/915647337333327091/figma-for-beginners-2020-petma-the-social-media-app-for-pets


TapTail brings real usability data into Figma with minimal effort. Install the plugin, create a prototype sharing link, share the link with your subjects and start collecting metrics. Once you collected enough data (at least one session), you will be able to generate a report directly in your prototype's Figma document (on a separate page).


💬 Feedback and questions (I read and reply to every e-mail): laci@taptail.com

♥️ Found it useful? A 'Like' would mean the world to me! :)


————————


Tired of bouncing between Figma and external usability test tools? With TapTail, you can see metrics directly in Figma:

  1. Session details: Total time spent, time to first click , count of unique sessions and more.
  2. Click positions: Numbered circles on each frame show exactly where and in what order users tapped.
  3. Interaction density: How many taps landed on each screen, helping you spot hot and cold zones.
  4. Labels: Add a tag when copying links to know which channel drove each test.


Your original designs stay untouched: all results are exported on a separate page and overlaid on separate layers of your designs' clones.


————————


🛟 How to use

A very detailed, step-by-step guide on how to create a sharing link and a report:


Creating a sharing link:

  1. Run the plugin.
  2. Click the blue 'Create' button.
  3. Provide a 'Name' and your Figma prototype's sharing URL (simply copy like you normally would and paste it here) then click the blue 'Create' button at the bottom. Once done, it will show you a list with the created item on top.
  4. Click the item's link icon to copy the TapTail sharing link: it will ask if you'd like to track the link (this is optional but recommended: use only numbers and lowercase, english alphabet letters without spaces).
  5. Click the blue 'Copy link [...]' button. Sharing link is now copied on your clipboard.
  6. Share the link with your test subjects. When they open it in their browser, your prototype will appear like the original Figma prototype (as if you would shared from the figma.com link).


Report generation:

  1. Run the plugin in the same Figma document where the shared prototype is located (this is important ❗️).
  2. You can check for new sessions with the 'Refresh' link on the top right corner.
  3. Once you have at least 1 session, you can create a report by pressing the 'Play' button.
  4. A confirmation pop-up will appear first. If you confirm, report generation will start and a loading indicator will appear (normally a report generation takes a few seconds, but could be more depending on your machine's computational capacity and the volume of the collected data).
  5. Report is generated on a new page in the document.


————————


⏳ License & Trial

TapTail is currently in open beta, therefore all features and functions are free for a limited period of time! Feedbacks, questions, bug reports: please and thank you 🤗


————————


🔐 Data handling & privacy

TapTail does NOT need access to your name, e-mail, files, comments, projects, components or styles to work. It only needs a very limited set of data to function:


Your identity

  1. Your Figma user ID is stored, but only in a scrambled form called a hash. A hash is like a one-way fingerprint: can't turn it back into the real ID. Your ID is needed to assign your account the free license.
  2. Other identity related data is only needed if you buy a license, then at least a billing name, billing address and an e-mail address is required.


Your prototype link

Your Figma prototype sharing URL (copied from Figma, provided by you manually) must be stored so your prototype can be served for your users via the TapTail sharing link (which looks like this: https://ux.taptail.com/s/<handle>). Part of the prototype link is a string called the 'file key' (format: https://www.figma.com/proto/<file key>/…) which identifies your Figma document. Since the prototype sharing URL is stored, the file key is also stored (as part of the URL). Read more about the implications here and here.


Prototype emitted events

List of Figma emitted events that are captured (with timestamp + data such as node ID, click and scroll cooridnates, etc. – for more info, click the event name below):

  1. MOUSE_PRESS_OR_RELEASE
  2. PRESENTED_NODE_CHANGED
  3. INITIAL_LOAD
  4. NEW_STATE
  5. REQUEST_CLOSE
  6. LOGIN_SCREEN_SHOWN
  7. PASSWORD_SCREEN_SHOWN


This data is only used to build your in-Figma reports and are never shared with anyone else.

You can learn more about embeds in general here: Embed Figma Files.


————————


🚧 Roadmap & new features

In no particular order, directly from my todo list:

  1. define expiration date+time;
  2. define simple instructions/ welcome screen;
  3. designated success screen (to enable missions);
  4. component variant change handling;
  5. data export in structured form (like JSON, CSV, …);
  6. <your ideas maybe? get in touch!>


————————


🪳 Found a bug? Got feedback? Have an idea for a feature?

E-mail me at laci@taptail.com!

I read and reply to every e-mail :)


————————


🫶 Credits

  1. The prototype used for demo in the video: https://www.figma.com/community/file/915647337333327091/figma-for-beginners-2020-petma-the-social-media-app-for-pets
plugins.tagline: Prototype usability analytics right inside Figma

136499.name: TapTail
136499.description:
😌 No explicit sign-ups, logins or permissions are required to use TapTail. Just run the plugin!


Have you ever wanted to know if the Figma proto you shared was opened? To see where people clicked? To get insights how your proto works? Read on 👇


Use this example prototype created by Figma to try: https://www.figma.com/community/file/915647337333327091/figma-for-beginners-2020-petma-the-social-media-app-for-pets


TapTail brings real usability data into Figma with minimal effort. Install the plugin, create a prototype sharing link, share the link with your subjects and start collecting metrics. Once you collected enough data (at least one session), you will be able to generate a report directly in your prototype's Figma document (on a separate page).


💬 Feedback and questions (I read and reply to every e-mail): laci@taptail.com

♥️ Found it useful? A 'Like' would mean the world to me! :)


————————


Tired of bouncing between Figma and external usability test tools? With TapTail, you can see metrics directly in Figma:

  1. Session details: Total time spent, time to first click , count of unique sessions and more.
  2. Click positions: Numbered circles on each frame show exactly where and in what order users tapped.
  3. Interaction density: How many taps landed on each screen, helping you spot hot and cold zones.
  4. Labels: Add a tag when copying links to know which channel drove each test.


Your original designs stay untouched: all results are exported on a separate page and overlaid on separate layers of your designs' clones.


————————


🛟 How to use

A very detailed, step-by-step guide on how to create a sharing link and a report:


Creating a sharing link:

  1. Run the plugin.
  2. Click the blue 'Create' button.
  3. Provide a 'Name' and your Figma prototype's sharing URL (simply copy like you normally would and paste it here) then click the blue 'Create' button at the bottom. Once done, it will show you a list with the created item on top.
  4. Click the item's link icon to copy the TapTail sharing link: it will ask if you'd like to track the link (this is optional but recommended: use only numbers and lowercase, english alphabet letters without spaces).
  5. Click the blue 'Copy link [...]' button. Sharing link is now copied on your clipboard.
  6. Share the link with your test subjects. When they open it in their browser, your prototype will appear like the original Figma prototype (as if you would shared from the figma.com link).


Report generation:

  1. Run the plugin in the same Figma document where the shared prototype is located (this is important ❗️).
  2. You can check for new sessions with the 'Refresh' link on the top right corner.
  3. Once you have at least 1 session, you can create a report by pressing the 'Play' button.
  4. A confirmation pop-up will appear first. If you confirm, report generation will start and a loading indicator will appear (normally a report generation takes a few seconds, but could be more depending on your machine's computational capacity and the volume of the collected data).
  5. Report is generated on a new page in the document.


————————


⏳ License & Trial

TapTail is currently in open beta, therefore all features and functions are free for a limited period of time! Feedbacks, questions, bug reports: please and thank you 🤗


————————


🔐 Data handling & privacy

TapTail does NOT need access to your name, e-mail, files, comments, projects, components or styles to work. It only needs a very limited set of data to function:


Your identity

  1. Your Figma user ID is stored, but only in a scrambled form called a hash. A hash is like a one-way fingerprint: can't turn it back into the real ID. Your ID is needed to assign your account the free license.
  2. Other identity related data is only needed if you buy a license, then at least a billing name, billing address and an e-mail address is required.


Your prototype link

Your Figma prototype sharing URL (copied from Figma, provided by you manually) must be stored so your prototype can be served for your users via the TapTail sharing link (which looks like this: https://ux.taptail.com/s/<handle>). Part of the prototype link is a string called the 'file key' (format: https://www.figma.com/proto/<file key>/…) which identifies your Figma document. Since the prototype sharing URL is stored, the file key is also stored (as part of the URL). Read more about the implications here and here.


Prototype emitted events

List of Figma emitted events that are captured (with timestamp + data such as node ID, click and scroll cooridnates, etc. – for more info, click the event name below):

  1. MOUSE_PRESS_OR_RELEASE
  2. PRESENTED_NODE_CHANGED
  3. INITIAL_LOAD
  4. NEW_STATE
  5. REQUEST_CLOSE
  6. LOGIN_SCREEN_SHOWN
  7. PASSWORD_SCREEN_SHOWN


This data is only used to build your in-Figma reports and are never shared with anyone else.

You can learn more about embeds in general here: Embed Figma Files.


————————


🚧 Roadmap & new features

In no particular order, directly from my todo list:

  1. define expiration date+time;
  2. define simple instructions/ welcome screen;
  3. designated success screen (to enable missions);
  4. component variant change handling;
  5. data export in structured form (like JSON, CSV, …);
  6. <your ideas maybe? get in touch!>


————————


🪳 Found a bug? Got feedback? Have an idea for a feature?

E-mail me at laci@taptail.com!

I read and reply to every e-mail :)


————————


🫶 Credits

  1. The prototype used for demo in the video: https://www.figma.com/community/file/915647337333327091/figma-for-beginners-2020-petma-the-social-media-app-for-pets
136499.release_notes: Show success message after adding new
136499.tagline: Prototype usability analytics right inside Figma

plugins.name: Sliding Text
plugins.description:
Sliding Text transforms static text into engaging animated components with just a few clicks. This plugin allows designers to:


  1. Convert any text layer into a dynamic text slide component
  2. Customize animation direction (top-to-bottom, bottom-to-top, left-to-right, right-to-left)
  3. Fine-tune animation timing, stagger delay, and easing
  4. Preview animations directly in the plugin interface
  5. Create components that maintain the original text's font, size, and styling
  6. Generate a "done" state for the final animation frame


Simply select a text layer, enter your phrases or words separated by commas, choose your animation settings, and let the plugin generate a fully configured component with smart animate transitions. Perfect for creating engaging sliding text / rotating messages / dynamic text effects without any coding knowledge.
plugins.tagline: Smooth text slide animations with customizable directions and timing

129512.description:

plugins.name: Calculator
plugins.description:
A handy Figma plugin designed to accelerate your workflow by instantly calculating totals from numerical values in text layers. Whether you're working on financial interfaces, data tables, or statistical visualizations, this tool ensures accuracy and efficiency with minimal effort.


How It Works:


Automatic Number Detection:

Quickly detects and extracts numbers from your selected text layers, effortlessly handling various formats:

  1. Simple numbers: 1234
  2. Decimal numbers: 1234.56 or 1234,56
  3. Numbers with thousand separators: 1,234.56 or 1.234,56


Real-Time Calculation:

Instantly calculates and displays the total sum of all detected numbers from your selected layers. Update your selection, and the total recalculates automatically.


Detailed View:

Offers an expandable detailed view showing each processed text layer along with its extracted numeric value, making it easy to verify and manage your data.


Key Features:


Real-Time Updates: Automatically refreshes calculations as your selection changes.

Adaptive Interface: Collapses the detailed view when no layers are selected, keeping your workspace clean.

Theme Support: Fully compatible with both light and dark Figma themes for optimal visibility.

Native Integration: Utilizes Figma’s native UI components for a seamless experience.


Who Is It For?


This plugin is ideal for designers who frequently handle numerical data within their designs. By automating the calculation process, it allows you to save valuable time and focus more on the creative aspects of your projects, enhancing productivity and accuracy.
plugins.tagline: Select text layers, instantly calculate their numerical values in real time.

127100.name: Calculator
127100.description:
A handy Figma plugin designed to accelerate your workflow by instantly calculating totals from numerical values in text layers. Whether you're working on financial interfaces, data tables, or statistical visualizations, this tool ensures accuracy and efficiency with minimal effort.


How It Works:


Automatic Number Detection:

Quickly detects and extracts numbers from your selected text layers, effortlessly handling various formats:

  1. Simple numbers: 1234
  2. Decimal numbers: 1234.56 or 1234,56
  3. Numbers with thousand separators: 1,234.56 or 1.234,56


Real-Time Calculation:

Instantly calculates and displays the total sum of all detected numbers from your selected layers. Update your selection, and the total recalculates automatically.


Detailed View:

Offers an expandable detailed view showing each processed text layer along with its extracted numeric value, making it easy to verify and manage your data.


Key Features:


Real-Time Updates: Automatically refreshes calculations as your selection changes.

Adaptive Interface: Collapses the detailed view when no layers are selected, keeping your workspace clean.

Theme Support: Fully compatible with both light and dark Figma themes for optimal visibility.

Native Integration: Utilizes Figma’s native UI components for a seamless experience.


Who Is It For?


This plugin is ideal for designers who frequently handle numerical data within their designs. By automating the calculation process, it allows you to save valuable time and focus more on the creative aspects of your projects, enhancing productivity and accuracy.
127100.release_notes:
Enhanced Number Parsing:
Improved handling of thousand separators (1,000 and 1.000)
Better detection of decimal points vs thousand separators
Support for both European (1.234,56) and American (1,234.56) number formats
Currency Support:
Added recognition of currency symbols ($, €, £, ₴, ¥, ₿)
Support for currency codes (USD, EUR, GBP, UAH, JPY, BTC, ETH, USDT)
Handles currency notation at both start and end of numbers (e.g., "$1,000" and "1,000 USD")
Error Handling:
Added informative messages when no text layers are selected
Added feedback when no valid numeric values are found
127100.tagline: Select text layers, instantly calculate their numerical values in real time.

plugins.name: Sudoku Frame
plugins.description:
Boost your design workflow with Sudoku Frame, the ultimate Figma plugin for creating customizable Sudoku tables in seconds! Perfect for designers, prototypers, and puzzle enthusiasts, this plugin lets you generate Sudoku grids with 4 difficulty levels—Easy, Medium, Hard, and Expert.


Choose between Numbers or Letters to suit your project’s style. With the Show Outlines mode, reveal answers effortlessly while keeping them hidden in the default view—ideal for testing, prototyping, or adding interactive elements to your designs.


Whether you're mocking up educational tools, game interfaces, or creative layouts, Sudoku Frame streamlines the process with precision and flexibility. Download now and start designing smarter!

plugins.name: Contrastio - Contrast & Accessibility Checker
plugins.description:
Contrastio helps you create more inclusive designs by automatically checking your work against WCAG accessibility guidelines.


🎯 Instant Accessibility Scanning

Check entire pages or specific frames with one click

Get real-time feedback on accessibility issues

Smart element exclusion with prefix system


📊 Comprehensive Checks

Color contrast validation (WCAG 2.0 & 2.1)

Typography accessibility analysis

Support for all compliance levels (A, AA, AAA)

Text readability assessment


🚀 Designer-Friendly Workflow

One-click element highlighting

Clear violation explanations

Grouped similar issues for easy fixes


⚡ Efficient & Fast

Scan thousands of elements in seconds

Stay in your design flow

No external tools needed


Why Contrastio?

Whether you're designing for government websites, enterprise applications, or simply want to create more inclusive designs, Contrastio helps ensure your work meets accessibility standards from the start.


Free Version Includes:

Up to 2,000 node scans per month


Pro Version ($4.99) Adds:

Unlimited node scanning

All new features coming along like reporting, screen/color modes.
plugins.tagline: Instant WCAG accessibility checks for your Figma designs

plugins.description:
Design Challenge Generator gives you random UI, UX, and Graphics challenges to practice and improve your skills. Perfect for beginners and experienced designers alike! Generate prompts, pick your favorite, and start designing.


How to Use:

  1. Open the plugin
  2. Select a category (UI, UX, or Graphics).
  3. Click "Generate" to get a random challenge.
  4. Keep generating until you find one you like.

plugins.name: Conjure - AI based text generator
plugins.description:
Introduction


Use your OpenAI API key with this plugin to quickly generate text for your designs. The plugin can allows to generate multiple text layers based on the content. Furthermore, it can also group the layers by their names, allowing you to use the layer names in the prompt to further elaborate how you want the data to be filled in.


How to use


The plugin was primarily created for 2 use cases:


1. Generate variations of a single type of data:

  1. Select all the text layers that show the same type of data and you want to generate variations of it. Imagine Name, City, Stock price, etc.
  2. Make sure 'Group by layer name' is OFF.
  3. Add details to the prompt to explain the type of content you want to be generated for the selected fields. Giving examples and formatting is also helpful.
  4. Click generate and it will fill the information!



2. Generate variations of multiple types of data:

  1. Select all the frames or components that you want to fill using this plugin.
  2. Turn ON 'Group by layer name'. The plugin will show you the layer names found.
  3. Add details to the prompt to explain the type of content you want to be generated for the selected fields. You can use the layer names to add specific context. Giving examples and formatting is also helpful.
  4. Click generate and it will fill the information!


3. Generated related data

You can use the group by layer name to select singular text layers which are related. An example is when you need text for First name, Last name, DoB, role, location and relatives. The plugin will try to generate related content for these layers.


Note


1. This plugin needs an OpenAI API Key to work.

2. I will recommend naming your text layers appropriately if you plan to use the Group by layer name feature. You can use it without naming the layers, but sometimes this might result in unexpected results.
plugins.tagline: OpenAI powered text generator with batch text generation feature

118471.name: Conjure - AI based text generator
118471.description:

Furthermore, it can also group the layers by their names, allowing you to use the layer names in the prompt to further elaborate how you want the data to be filled in.


How to use


The plugin was primarily created for 2 use cases:


1. Generate variations of a single type of data:

  2. Make sure 'Group by layer name' is OFF.
  3. Add details to the prompt to explain the type of content you want to be generated for the selected fields. Giving examples and formatting is also helpful.
  4. Click generate and it will fill the information!



2. Generate variations of multiple types of data:

  1. Select all the frames or components that you want to fill using this plugin.
  2. Turn ON 'Group by layer name'. The plugin will show you the layer names found.
  3. Add details to the prompt to explain the type of content you want to be generated for the selected fields. You can use the layer names to add specific context. Giving examples and formatting is also helpful.
  4. Click generate and it will fill the information!


3. Generated related data

You can use the group by layer name to select singular text layers which are related. An example is when you need text for First name, Last name, DoB, role, location and relatives. The plugin will try to generate related content for these layers.


Note


1. This plugin needs an OpenAI API Key to work.

2. I will recommend naming your text layers appropriately if you plan to use the Group by layer name feature. You can use it without naming the layers, but sometimes this might result in unexpected results.

plugins.name: JumpMark (Jump Between Marked Figma Components Instantly)
plugins.description:
JumpMark transforms the way you navigate through complex Figma files. This powerful plugin lets you create smart bookmarks for your most-used components, layers, and sections, enabling instant navigation with smooth animations.


🎥 Watch Tutorial | 📱 Follow Us


Key Features:

  1. Smart Bookmark Groups: Organize your bookmarks into custom groups for different project sections, components, or workflows
  2. One-Click Navigation: Jump between bookmarked locations instantly with beautiful smooth animations
  3. Visual Labeling: Color-code your bookmarks and groups for quick visual recognition
  4. Notes & Documentation: Add helpful notes to bookmarks for team collaboration
  5. Drag & Drop Organization: Easily reorder bookmarks within groups
  6. Search Functionality: Quickly find any bookmark or group using the search feature
  7. Custom Animation Settings: Adjust transition speed and style for comfortable navigation


Perfect For:

  1. UX/UI designers working with large design systems
  2. Design teams collaborating on complex projects
  3. Product designers managing multiple component states
  4. Anyone working with extensive Figma files


How It Works:

  1. Select any elements you want to bookmark
  2. Create a group to organize related bookmarks
  3. Add bookmarks with optional notes and color labels
  4. Navigate instantly between locations with a single click


Free Trial Available:

116083.name: JumpMark (Jump Between Marked Figma Components Instantly)
116083.description:
JumpMark transforms the way you navigate through complex Figma files. This powerful plugin lets you create smart bookmarks for your most-used components, layers, and sections, enabling instant navigation with smooth animations.


🎥 Watch Tutorial | 📱 Follow Us


Key Features:

  1. Smart Bookmark Groups: Organize your bookmarks into custom groups for different project sections, components, or workflows
  2. One-Click Navigation: Jump between bookmarked locations instantly with beautiful smooth animations
  3. Visual Labeling: Color-code your bookmarks and groups for quick visual recognition
  4. Notes & Documentation: Add helpful notes to bookmarks for team collaboration
  5. Drag & Drop Organization: Easily reorder bookmarks within groups
  6. Search Functionality: Quickly find any bookmark or group using the search feature
  7. Custom Animation Settings: Adjust transition speed and style for comfortable navigation


Perfect For:

  1. UX/UI designers working with large design systems
  2. Design teams collaborating on complex projects
  3. Product designers managing multiple component states
  4. Anyone working with extensive Figma files


How It Works:

  1. Select any elements you want to bookmark
  2. Create a group to organize related bookmarks
  3. Add bookmarks with optional notes and color labels
  4. Navigate instantly between locations with a single click

plugins.name: Text binder for AI
plugins.description:
Text Binder for AI

A LLM-optimized plugin that lets you enhance text content with AI while preserving your Figma designs. Built with AI guardrails, this plugin safely extracts, processes, and updates text across multiple frames without breaking layouts or losing design fidelity.


✨ Key Features

🎯 AI-Ready Content Extraction

  1. Extract text with reference tags for LLM processing
  2. Maintain exact positioning and styling information
  3. Process multiple frames simultaneously
  4. Built-in prompts and guardrails for AI safety


🔄 Validated Content Updates

  1. Preview AI-generated changes before applying
  2. Intelligent length validation for layout preservation
  3. Real-time status checks for each text element
  4. Clear warnings for potential layout impacts


🚀 Getting Started

  1. Select your target frames
  2. Extract text with AI-friendly reference tags
  3. Use any LLM while maintaining the safety tags
  4. Review changes with automatic validation
  5. Apply updates with confidence
plugins.tagline: AI-enhanced, design-protected

plugins.name: 角落艺术家
plugins.description:
In the new version of "Corner Artist," I've added a language switch feature between Chinese and English. Here, you can freely switch to your preferred language as needed.


The new version optimizes the user experience, making the overall UI more refined and convenient.


By clicking the button, you can randomly switch to your favorite gradient colors.

Additionally, the new version introduces a "Random Corner Radius" feature, allowing you to choose the layer you want to modify and adjust the corner radius strength.


Here, the higher the value, the smaller the corner radius strength.


I’ve used the superellipse corner radius formula:

|x/a|^n + |y/b|^n = 1

When n = 2, it’s a regular ellipse;

When n < 2, it’s a superellipse;

The smaller the value of n, the closer the corners are to right angles.


For those interested, you can explore the formula on your own; I’ll post it in the comments.

When you choose a corner radius strength less than 1, you'll also receive stars as a bonus.


That's about it for the new features. Feel free to experience and save them!
plugins.tagline: Making the overall UI more refined and convenient.

113419.name: 角落艺术家
113419.description:

plugins.name: Text Color Pairs To Variables
plugins.description:
Usage

  1. Create a frame with any name.
  2. Inside the frame created in step 1, create another frame named variableColorItem.
  3. Inside variableColorItem, create a frame named variableColor.
  4. Set a fill color for variableColor.
  5. Within variableColorItem, create a text layer named variableName.
  6. Select the frame you created in step 1.
  7. Launch the plugin.
  8. Click the button.
  9. The color of variableColor will be registered as a local variable under the name variableName.
plugins.tagline: Generate variables from color and text combinations.

89740.name: Text Color Pairs To Variables
89740.description:
Usage

  1. Create a frame with any name.
  2. Inside the frame created in step 1, create another frame named variableColorItem.
  3. Inside variableColorItem, create a frame named variableColor.
  4. Set a fill color for variableColor.
  5. Within variableColorItem, create a text layer named variableName.
  6. Select the frame you created in step 1.
  7. Launch the plugin.
  8. Click the button.
  9. The color of variableColor will be registered as a local variable under the name variableName.
89740.release_notes:
1. We have changed the plugin name.
2. We have changed the plugin cover image.
89740.tagline: Generate variables from color and text combinations.

plugins.name: Layout Lab
plugins.description:
Transform your design workflow with automated layout perfection. This powerful plugin streamlines your design process by intelligently handling spacing, alignment, and organization – saving you valuable time while ensuring pixel-perfect results.


🎯 Key Features:

  1. Auto-Layout: Instantly structure frames and elements with intelligent automation
  2. Perfect Spacing: Apply consistent spacing between elements with a single click
  3. Smart Grouping: Organize similar frames and elements into clean, logical layouts
  4. Nested Layer Support: Apply consistent spacing across all layer depths
  5. Customizable Settings: Fine-tune spacing, gaps, and layout modes to match your needs


💪 Perfect For:

  1. UI/UX Designers creating complex interfaces
  2. Design teams maintaining consistency across projects
  3. Product designers working on component libraries
  4. Anyone looking to speed up their layout workflow


🚀 How It Works:

  1. Select the elements you want to organize
  2. Choose your preferred layout settings
  3. Let the plugin work its magic!


✨ Benefits:

  1. Save hours on manual layout adjustments
  2. Maintain consistent spacing throughout your designs
  3. Reduce time spent on repetitive tasks
  4. Create more professional, polished layouts
  5. Ensure design system compliance


🎨 Supported Features:

  1. Auto-spacing calculation
  2. Intelligent grouping
  3. Responsive layouts
  4. Multi-selection support
  5. Custom spacing presets
  6. Quick actions


Made with ❤️ by a designer for designers. We're constantly improving – your feedback helps make this plugin better for everyone!
plugins.tagline: Automate your design workflow with perfect spacing, smart grouping, and pixel-perfect layouts

Made with ❤️ by a designer for designers. We're constantly improving – your feedback helps make this plugin better for everyone!
115633.release_notes:
I'm excited to announce the latest updates to the Layout Lab Plugin! Here’s what’s new:

🚀 New Features:
Rectangles Added to Defined Node: Rectangles are now recognized as valid nodes and included in the auto-layout system.

🛠 Enhancements:
Horizontal Layout Improvements: Enhanced grouping of frames with similar Y positions (within a 3-pixel tolerance) into horizontal rows for better alignment.

📝 How to Use:
Rectangles: Select rectangles with other nodes and run the plugin.
Horizontal Layout: Select frames with similar Y positions for automatic grouping.

Thank you for using the Layout Lab Plugin! 🎨
115633.tagline: Automate your design workflow with perfect spacing, smart grouping, and pixel-perfect layouts

✅ Typography (Font Size, Line Height, Letter Spacing)

plugins.name: Select Matching Layers in Frame
plugins.description:
Instantly find repeated frames or component instances within the same frame and edit them all at once.


Figma’s built-in “Select Matching Layers” feature only works across different frames. This plugin is similar but works within a single frame. Quickly select repeating elements within a single frame and adjust their properties, just like the multi-edit feature. For convenience I recommend setting up a custom shortcut for the plugin.


Pair with Master plugin

Turn matching layers into a single component in seconds with the Master plugin:

1. Use Select Matching Layers in Frame to find all repeated elements

2. Run Master → Create Component from Objects

3. Done. You’ll get a single, clean component with overrides preserved


Technical details:

  1. Select all instances of a component (including variants) when selecting an instance
  2. Select all layers with matching name and type when selecting any other layer
  3. Searches within the same frame only
  4. Select multiple objects within different frames, plugin will find all the matches


If you have any questions or feedback, please comment below!
plugins.tagline: Instantly find, select and edit similar layers within a single frame
